csimage
Class CSImage

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Image
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage
          csimage.CSImage
All Implemented Interfaces:
RenderedImage, WritableRenderedImage, Transparency
public class CSImage
extends BufferedImage

The CSImage class provides simplified interface to the Java's image processing classes. The class is a direct extension of the BufferedImage class with a much simplified interface. The CSImage class has no public constructors. Rather, CSImage objects should be created using one of the factory methods, createImage(...). For example: 

   CSImage image = CSIMage.createImage("anImage.jpg");
A CSImage object can may be created from a JPEG, GIFF, PNG, or BMP file.

Version:
1.0
Author:
S. Sigman
See Also:
BufferedImage

Method Detail

copy

public CSImage copy()
             throws CSImageCopyFailure
Returns a copy of the image. A deep copy of the image is made. A CSImageCopyFailure exception will be thrown if the copy operation fails for any reason. This exception is an unchecked exception.

Returns:
CSImage that is a copy of this image
Throws:
CSImageCopyFailure

createImage

public static CSImage createImage(int[][] pixels)
                           throws CSImagePixelValueException
Creates a greyscale image from the data stored in a two dimensional array. Each (row, col) coordinate contains the data for a single pixel in the image. Each pixel value should be in the range 0..255. A CSImagePixelValueException is thrown if any of the pixel values in the array are out of range. As in the following example, good programming practice dictates that a call to the method should be surrounded by a try\catch block.However, the exception is unchecked and the try\catch block may be omitted.
Example: 
        int width = ...;
        int height = ...;
        int [][] imageData = new int [width][height];
        // code to fill imageData
        CSImage image = null;;
        try {
                image = CSImage.createImage(imageData);
        } catch (CSImagePixelValueException e)
                System.out.println(e.getMessage());
                e.printStackTrace();
                System.exit(1);
        }





Parameters:
pixels - 2 dimensional array of grayscale image data

Returns:
CSImage Greyscale CSImage of the data

Throws:

CSImagePixelValueException

createImage

public static CSImage createImage(int[][][] pixels)
                           throws CSImagePixelValueException
Creates a color image from the data stored in the 3 dimensional array of pixels. Dimension one of the pixel array defines the height of the image. Dimension two defines the width of the array. Dimension three defiens the RED, GREEN, BLUE bands of each pixel. The third dimension must be of length 3, one for each band. The value specified for each band must be in the range 0..255. Good programming practice dictates that, as in the following example, a call to the method should be enclosed in a try/catch block. However, the exception is unchecked and the try/chatch block may be omitted. Example (defining a 200 wide by 300 heigh image): 
    int [][][] imageData = new int [200][300][3];
    //code to fill image data with values
    CSImage image = null;
    try {
      image = CSImage.createImage(imageData);
    } catch (CSImagePixelValueException e) {
        System.out.println(e.getMessage());
        e.printStackTrace();
      System.exit(1);
    }

Parameters:
pixels - 3 dimensional array of pixel values
Returns:
A color CSImage object
Throws:
CSImagePixelValueException
See Also:
RED_BAND, GREEN_BAND, BLUE_BAND

createImage

public static CSImage createImage(int[] pixels,
                                  int width,
                                  int height)
Creates a grayscale CSImage object from the data in a one dimensional array. The image is assumed to be stored in the array in row major order. Each array cell value should be in the range 0..255. Note Unlike the other createImage factory methods, this method does not throw an exception.
Example: 
     int width = ...;
     int height = ...;
     int [] imgData = new int[width*height];
     //code to load image into imgData
     CSImage image = CSImage.createImage(imgData,
                                         width,
                                         height);

Parameters:
pixels - Array of values defining the image data
width - Width of the image
height - Height of the image
Returns:
Grayscale CSImage object of the image

createImage

public static CSImage createImage(String filename)
                           throws CSImageFileException
Creates a CSImage object from the specified image file. This method is a factory method used to create CSImage objects from images stored in files. If the image file is not found or cannot be read a CSImageFileException will be thrown. As in the following example, the call to the method must be enclosed in a try/cathc block or the enclosing method must itself throw a CSImageFileException.
Example: 
        CSImage image = null;
        try {
                image = CSImage.createImage(C:\mypictures\pict.jpg);
        } catch (CSImageFileException e) {
                System.out.println(e.getMessage());
                e.printStackTrace();
                System.exit(1);
        }

Parameters:
filename - The file name of the original image.
Returns:
CSImage A new CSImage object created from the specified file
Throws:
CSImageFileException

createImage

public static CSImage createImage(URL url)
                           throws CSImageURLException
Creates a CSImage object from the image at the specified URL. This method is a factory method used to create CSImage objects from the image at the specified URL. If the image is not found at the given URL or cannot be read a CSImageURLException is trhown. As in the following example, the call to the method must be surrounded by a try/catch block or the enclosing method must throw a CSImageURLException.
Example: 
     URL theURL = new URL("http://somewhere.domain/pict.jpg");
     CSImage image = null;
     try {
         image = CSImage.createImage(theURL);
     } catch (CSImageURLException e) {
       System.out.println(e.getMessage());
       e.printStackTrace();
       System.exit(1);
     }

Parameters:
url - The URL to the original image.
Returns:
CSImage A CSImage object created from the specified URL.
Throws:
CSImageURLException

export

public void export(String filename,
                   String format)
            throws CSImageFileException
Exports the current image in the specified format to the file specified. In the case of an error creating or writing the export file, a CSImageFileException will be thrown. Since, this exception is a checked exception, a call to the export method must be enclosed in a try/catch block or the enclosing method must throw the exception.

Parameters:
filename - Name of the image to create.
format - Format in which to store the image.
Throws:
CSImageFileException
See Also:
JPG, BMP, PNG

getPixel

public int[] getPixel(int x,
                      int y)
Returns the values of each band for the specified pixel as an array of values. For a color image the returned array will have three elements, one for each band. The band constants RED_BAND, GREEN_BAND, and BLUE_BAND should be used to access the color components of the pixel. For a grayscale image the returned array will contain a single element.
Example 
  // get the pixel at position (240, 400)
        int [] pixel = image.getPixel(240, 400);
  System.out.println("Red: " + pixel[CSImage.RED_BAND);
  System.out.println("Green: " + pixel[CSImage.GREEN_BAND);
  System.out.println("Blue: " + pixel[CSImage.BLUE_BAND);

Parameters:
x - x-coordinate of pixel
y - y-coordinate of pixel
Returns:
The band values for the pixel in a one dimensional array

getPixels1D

public int[] getPixels1D(int band)
                  throws CSImageIllegalBand
Returns an one dimensional array of pixel values from the specified band. The band specified must be legal for the type of image. Legal values are:
  • Greyscale
    • GRAY_BAND
  • RGB Color Image
    • RED_BAND
    • GREEN_BAND
    • BLUE_BAND
In the case an illegal band is specified a CSImageIllegalBand exception will be raised. The exception is an unchecked exception.

Parameters:
band - the band of pixel values in the image to return
Returns:
one dimensional array of pixel values
Throws:
CSImageIllegalBand

getPixels2D

public int[][] getPixels2D(int band)
                    throws CSImageIllegalBand
Returns a two dimensional array of pixel values from the specified band. The band specified must be legal for the type of image. Legal values are:
  • Greyscale
    • GRAY_BAND
  • RGB Color Image
    • RED_BAND
    • GREEN_BAND
    • BLUE_BAND
In the case an illegal band is specified a CSImageIllegalBand exception will be raised. The exception is an unchecked exception.

Parameters:
band - The band of pixel values in the image to return
Returns:
A two dimensional array of pixel values from the specified band
Throws:
CSImageIllegalBand

getPixels3D

public int[][][] getPixels3D()
                      throws CSImageIllegalBand
Returns the pixel values in the image as two dimensional array of the red, green, and blue bands of the image. This method is to be used with color images. If used with a grayscale image an CSIllegalBand exception will be thrown. The exception is an unchecked exception.

Returns:
Three dimensional array of pixel values
Throws:
CSImageIllegalBand

setPixel

public void setPixel(int x,
                     int y,
                     int[] pixel)
Sets the band components of the pixel at the specified coordinate to the values contained in the input array. For a colored image, values for the RED_BAND, the GREEN_BAND, and the BLUE_BAND must be specified in this order. For a grayscale image, the input array must contain a single value corresponding to the GRAY_BAND.

Parameters:
x - x-coordinate of the pixel
y - y-coordinate of the pixel
pixel - one dimensional array of band values for the pixel

setPixels

public void setPixels(int[][][] pixels)
               throws CSImageIllegalBand
Sets the pixel values in the image to a two dimensional array of the red, green, and blue values. This method is to be used with color images. If used with a grayscale image an CSIllegalBand exception will be returned. The exception is an unchecked exception.

Parameters:
pixels - Three dimensional array of pixel values
Throws:
CSImageIllegalBand

setPixels

public void setPixels(int[][] pixels,
                      int band)
               throws CSImageIllegalBand
Sets a value for the specified band of each pixel in the image from the input two dimensional array. The array must have the same dimensions a the image. The band specified must be appropriate for the image type, if not, a CSImageIllegalBand exception will be thrown. The exception is an unchecked exception.

Parameters:
pixels - A one dimensional array of new values-one per pixel.
band - The band in each pixel to update.
Throws:
CSImageIllegalBand

setPixels

public void setPixels(int[] pixels,
                      int band)
               throws CSImageIllegalBand
Sets a value for the specified band of each pixel in the image from a one dimensional array of input values. The input array (pixels) must have one entry for each pixel in the image. The values in the pixels array must be arranged in row major order. The band specified must be appropriate for the image type, if not, a CSImageIllegalBand exception will be thrown. The exception is an unchecked exception.

Parameters:
pixels - A one dimensional array of new values-one per pixel.
band - The band in each pixel to update.
Throws:
CSImageIllegalBand
